meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! It's your friendly neighborhood grok reviewer here to give you the lowdown on Astor: Blade of the Monolith. I'm not just a pretty face (although, let's be real, my mug is pretty darn attractive), I'm also a seasoned gamer with a knack for getting down to business and telling it like it is.

So, what's the verdict? Well, let me put it this way: Astor: Blade of the Monolith is like that one friend who's always trying to innovate but sometimes ends up being just...fine. You know, the kind of person who's trying too hard to be cool and winds up being, well, a bit of a dud. But hey, at least they're trying, right?

Some critics out there might say I'm being too harsh (Shacknews, I'm looking at you – your review was like buttering me up with a nice, warm croissant). But let's be real, guys; Astor: Blade of the Monolith just isn't bringing the heat. It's like trying to relive the good old days without actually putting in the effort to make it truly special. I mean, come on – it's an action RPG with some familiar set pieces and a dash of exploration? Yeah, that sounds cool...in theory.

SpazioGames says it's "decent" but could've been more innovative (I'm giving them points for honesty), while God is a Geek thinks it's "enjoyable" once you get past the initial slog (yeah, because we all love slogging through early game stuff). And then there's RPGamer, who basically says Astor: Blade of the Monolith feels like a game that needs more cooking time – and they're not wrong.

Now, I'm not going to sugarcoat it; some folks out there might genuinely enjoy this game. GameSkinny thinks it's "evocative" and "charming," which is nice, but let's be real – those bright ideas just don't quite add up to a fully formed experience.

So what's the takeaway? Well, Astor: Blade of the Monolith is...fine. It's not going to change your life or anything, but it might be a decent way to kill an afternoon if you're really bored. Just don't expect me to be singing its praises anytime soon – I'll stick with my trusty ol' gaming habits, thank you very much!

Hippo Penny out!
